$TSLA here is another FUD, misquoting the article from Electrek, CNN is a shame. https://www.cnbc.com/2018/10/12/tesla-produced-7400-model-3s-in-the-first-two-weeks-of-the-quarter.html

links.title: Tesla produced 7,400 Model 3 sedans in the first two weeks of the quarter, report says
links.description: David Paul Morris | Bloomberg | Getty Images Tesla has produced 7,400 Model 3 mid-sized sedans in the first two weeks of the quarter, according to a report in Electrek, citing unnamed people. That would mean Tesla has so far produced 3,700 Model 3's per week, short of the goal of 5,000 cars per week Tesla has been aiming for and occasionally hit.

links.description: From Hawaii to North Carolina to New York, numerous efforts are being made to rapidly deploy clean energy supporting battery storage systems. links.title: And There Was Light And The Stock Market Rose -
links.description: It is Friday, and this has been a crazy week for me with the stock market and a water leak in my house due to a broken pipe which created all sorts of havoc. But at least today is Friday, and to me, it feels like a giant weight was removed from my shoulders.

links.title: After Taunting Shorts With Threats Of "Unreal Carnage", Musk Buys $10MM In Tesla Stock
links.description: Elon Musk's feud with Tesla shorts is not business, it's just personal. After lashing out at some vast, anti-Tesla conspiracy (technically, he has a point, Tesla is the most shorted US stock for good reason) in the aftermath of last week's earnings bizarre conference debacle Musk first warned shorts that " oh and uh short burn of the century comin soon.

links.title: Will Elon Musk Be the Next CEO to Face A Margin Call Death-Spiral?
links.description: In the annals of CEO margin-call history, among the most infamous are Worldcom's Bernie Ebbers, Chesapeake's Aubrey McLendon and Steinhoff's Christo Wiese. Is Tesla CEO Elon Musk on the path to joining them?
